intro: Persicaria minuta, commonly known as little knotweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming from June to August. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Persicaria minuta thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
